summary: Build a Valentine-themed website featuring a 5-level treasure hunt quiz titled "The hunt to find your favourite girl", with multiple-choice and free-text questions, slide-based progression, feedback messaging, and sound on wrong answers.
known_issues: Question text is being truncated/half cut in the UI; needs layout/CSS adjustment so questions display fully.
Production deployment/publishing is failing with a deployment error (launch unsuccessful).

existing_features.title: Create a Valentine-themed single-page quiz experience titled "The hunt to find your favourite girl" with 5 levels (one question per level) and a final completion slide.

Implement Level 1 as a multiple-choice question: "Where was the first time you saw me?" with four options exactly: (1) "In Ibrahim's my wedding" (2) "In Shabbir's bhai wedding" (3) "In your mama's wedding" (4) "in the school"; mark only "In your mama's wedding" as the correct answer.

Implement Level 2 as a multiple-choice question: "What's the one thing that make me smile secretly?" with four options exactly: (1) "Your geniusness" (2) "Your care" (3) " your hardwork" (4) "or you"; mark only "you" (option text exactly "or you") as the correct answer.

Implement Level 3 as a multiple-choice question: "What will be your reactiom when you find out that I will be going to jail just because I did something stupid." with four options exactly: (1) "I knew it" (2) "You are crazy" (3) "How can you do this" (4) "Oh men you should told me we would done it together"; treat every option as correct and always advance to Level 4 after selection.

Implement Level 4 as a multiple-choice question: "What make you love more ?" with four options exactly: (1) "My love" (2) "My smile" (3) "My eyes" (4) " whole me"; mark only "whole me" (option text exactly " whole me") as correct.

Implement Level 5 as a free-text question: "When did you find that I am the one for you?" and provide a writing box (multi-line text area) plus a submit/continue action that advances to the final completion slide.

Add answer feedback behavior: when a user selects an incorrect option on Levels 1, 2, or 4, play a "Buzz" sound and display the message exactly: "do you really think this? Think more"; on correct answers, advance to the next question slide.

Create the final completion slide shown after Level 5 submission with the message exactly: "Well I knew you find your favourite girl well that's me I know. You have done a good job so in the reward You get me for your lifetimeðŸ¥°." and an "The over" end indicator.
Apply a coherent Valentine visual theme across the entire experience (consistent colors, typography, and layout) suitable for a romantic treasure-hunt quiz.
Add required generated image assets to the frontend as static files and use them in the UI (do not fetch images through the backend). Place generated images under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Fix the UI so quiz question titles are never truncated/half-cut and always display fully (wrap to multiple lines when needed) across all levels, especially on small/mobile screens.
Add an intro animation/intro screen before Level 1 begins, and allow the user to start the quiz from that intro screen.
When a user selects a correct answer on Levels 1, 2, and 4, show a slightly longer, more romantic success animation/feedback moment before advancing to the next slide.
Investigate and fix the production publishing/deployment error so the app can be successfully built and published to production.
Implement a smoother visual transition from the Intro screen to Level 1 (fade or similar), so starting the quiz feels seamless.

Verify in the production build that all quiz question titles and prompts render fully (no truncation/half-cut), especially on small mobile screens, and fix any remaining layout/CSS issues causing cut-off text.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create Valentine-themed treasure hunt quiz website with 5 levels, specified questions/options/answers, slide navigation, buzz sound + prompt on wrong answers, free-text input on final question, and a final reward slide message.
Add an intro animation before the quiz begins.
On correct answers, play a more romantic animation/feedback effect before advancing.
